info.title: Gitea API.
info.description: This documentation describes the Gitea API.

get.summary: Returns the nodeinfo of the Gitea application
List users's notification threads

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: If true, show notifications marked as read. Default value is false

parameters.name: status-types
parameters.description: Show notifications with the provided status types. Options are: unread, read and/or pinned. Defaults to unread & pinned.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in RFC 3339 format

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Only show notifications updated before the given time. This is a timestamp in RFC 3339 format

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: page number of results to return (1-based)

put.summary: Mark notification threads as read, pinned or unread

parameters.name: last_read_at
parameters.description: Describes the last point that notifications were checked. Anything updated since this time will not be updated.

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: If true, mark all notifications on this repo. Default value is false

parameters.name: status-types
parameters.description: Mark notifications with the provided status types. Options are: unread, read and/or pinned. Defaults to unread.

parameters.name: to-status
parameters.description: Status to mark notifications as, Defaults to read.

get.summary: Gets a package
Gets all files of a package
Search for issues across the repositories that the user has access to

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: whether issue is open or closed

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: comma separated list of labels. Fetch only issues that have any of this labels. Non existent labels are discarded

parameters.name: milestones
parameters.description: comma separated list of milestone names. Fetch only issues that have any of this milestones. Non existent are discarded

parameters.name: priority_repo_id
parameters.description: repository to prioritize in the results

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: filter by type (issues / pulls) if set

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in RFC 3339 format

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Only show notifications updated before the given time. This is a timestamp in RFC 3339 format

parameters.name: assigned
parameters.description: filter (issues / pulls) assigned to you, default is false

parameters.name: created
parameters.description: filter (issues / pulls) created by you, default is false

parameters.name: mentioned
parameters.description: filter (issues / pulls) mentioning you, default is false

parameters.name: review_requested
parameters.description: filter pulls requesting your review, default is false

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: filter by team (requires organization owner parameter to be provided)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: page number of results to return (1-based)

409.description: The repository with the same name already exists.

get.summary: Search for repositories

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description: Limit search to repositories with keyword as topic

parameters.name: includeDesc
parameters.description: include search of keyword within repository description

parameters.name: uid
parameters.description: search only for repos that the user with the given id owns or contributes to

parameters.name: priority_owner_id
parameters.description: repo owner to prioritize in the results

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: search only for repos that belong to the given team id

parameters.name: starredBy
parameters.description: search only for repos that the user with the given id has starred

parameters.name: private
parameters.description: include private repositories this user has access to (defaults to true)

parameters.name: is_private
parameters.description: show only pubic, private or all repositories (defaults to all)

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: include template repositories this user has access to (defaults to true)

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: show only archived, non-archived or all repositories (defaults to all)

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: type of repository to search for. Supported values are "fork", "source", "mirror" and "collaborative"

parameters.name: exclusive
parameters.description: if `uid` is given, search only for repos that the user owns

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: sort repos by attribute. Supported values are "alpha", "created", "updated", "size", and "id". Default is "alpha"

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: sort order, either "asc" (ascending) or "desc" (descending). Default is "asc", ignored if "sort" is not specified.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: page number of results to return (1-based)

get.summary: Get a repository

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: owner of the repo to delete

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: name of the repo to delete

get.summary: Get available issue templates for a repository
List a repository's issues

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: whether issue is open or closed

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: comma separated list of labels. Fetch only issues that have any of this labels. Non existent labels are discarded

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: filter by type (issues / pulls) if set

parameters.name: milestones
parameters.description: comma separated list of milestone names or ids. It uses names and fall back to ids. Fetch only issues that have any of this milestones. Non existent milestones are discarded

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Only show items updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in RFC 3339 format

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Only show items updated before the given time. This is a timestamp in RFC 3339 format

parameters.name: created_by
parameters.description: Only show items which were created by the the given user

parameters.name: assigned_by
parameters.description: Only show items for which the given user is assigned

parameters.name: mentioned_by
parameters.description: Only show items in which the given user was mentioned

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: page number of results to return (1-based)

post.summary: Create an issue. If using deadline only the date will be taken into account, and time of day ignored.

get.summary: List users's notification threads on a specific repo

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: If true, show notifications marked as read. Default value is false

parameters.name: status-types
parameters.description: Show notifications with the provided status types. Options are: unread, read and/or pinned. Defaults to unread & pinned

parameters.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in RFC 3339 format

parameters.description: Describes the last point that notifications were checked. Anything updated since this time will not be updated.

APIError.description: APIError is an api error with a message

AccessToken.title: AccessToken represents an API access token.

ChangedFile.description: ChangedFile store information about files affected by the pull request

Commit.title: Commit contains information generated from a Git commit.

CommitAffectedFiles.description: CommitAffectedFiles store information about files affected by the commit

CommitDateOptions.description: CommitDateOptions store dates for GIT_AUTHOR_DATE and GIT_COMMITTER_DATE

CommitStatusState holds the state of a CommitStatus

content.description: `content` is populated when `type` is `file`, otherwise null

encoding.description: `encoding` is populated when `type` is `file`, otherwise null

submodule_git_url.description: `submodule_git_url` is populated when `type` is `submodule`, otherwise null

target.description: `target` is populated when `type` is `symlink`, otherwise null

ContentsResponse.description: ContentsResponse contains information about a repo's entry's (dir, file, symlink, submodule) metadata and content

message.description: message (optional) for the commit of this file. if not supplied, a default message will be used

new_branch.description: new_branch (optional) will make a new branch from `branch` before creating the file

signoff.description: Add a Signed-off-by trailer by the committer at the end of the commit log message.

message.description: message (optional) for the commit of this file. if not supplied, a default message will be used

allow_manual_merge.description: either `true` to allow mark pr as merged manually, or `false` to prevent it.

allow_merge_commits.description: either `true` to allow merging pull requests with a merge commit, or `false` to prevent merging pull requests with merge commits.

allow_rebase.description: either `true` to allow rebase-merging pull requests, or `false` to prevent rebase-merging.

allow_rebase_explicit.description: either `true` to allow rebase with explicit merge commits (--no-ff), or `false` to prevent rebase with explicit merge commits.

allow_rebase_update.description: either `true` to allow updating pull request branch by rebase, or `false` to prevent it.

allow_squash_merge.description: either `true` to allow squash-merging pull requests, or `false` to prevent squash-merging.

archived.description: set to `true` to archive this repository.

autodetect_manual_merge.description: either `true` to enable AutodetectManualMerge, or `false` to prevent it. Note: In some special cases, misjudgments can occur.

default_branch.description: sets the default branch for this repository.

default_delete_branch_after_merge.description: set to `true` to delete pr branch after merge by default

default_merge_style.description: set to a merge style to be used by this repository: "merge", "rebase", "rebase-merge", or "squash".

description.description: a short description of the repository.

enable_prune.description: enable prune - remove obsolete remote-tracking references

has_issues.description: either `true` to enable issues for this repository or `false` to disable them.

has_projects.description: either `true` to enable project unit, or `false` to disable them.

has_pull_requests.description: either `true` to allow pull requests, or `false` to prevent pull request.

has_wiki.description: either `true` to enable the wiki for this repository or `false` to disable it.

ignore_whitespace_conflicts.description: either `true` to ignore whitespace for conflicts, or `false` to not ignore whitespace.

mirror_interval.description: set to a string like `8h30m0s` to set the mirror interval time

private.description:
either `true` to make the repository private or `false` to make it public.
Note: you will get a 422 error if the organization restricts changing repository visibility to organization
owners and a non-owner tries to change the value of private.

template.description: either `true` to make this repository a template or `false` to make it a normal repository

website.description: a URL with more information about the repository.

EditRepoOption.description: EditRepoOption options when editing a repository's properties

EditTeamOption.description: EditTeamOption options for editing a team

Email.description: Email an email address belonging to a user

external_tracker_format.description: External Issue Tracker URL Format. Use the placeholders {user}, {repo} and {index} for the username, repository name and issue index.

external_tracker_regexp_pattern.description: External Issue Tracker issue regular expression

external_tracker_style.description: External Issue Tracker Number Format, either `numeric`, `alphanumeric`, or `regexp`

ExternalTracker.description: ExternalTracker represents settings for external tracker

ExternalWiki.description: ExternalWiki represents setting for external wiki
